title: Low-So Good (2016).pdf Gooner
description:
Low-So Good - A Guide to Real Food, Big Flavor and Less Sodium with 70 Amazing Recipes (2016).pdf Gooner

Publisher: Chronicle Books; 01 edition (14 Jun. 2016)
Language: English
ISBN-10: 1452135088
ISBN-13: 978-1452135083

This is a comprehensive yet inspiring general special-diet cookbook that breaks downs the challenges and miss-perceptions associated with following a low-sodium diet. Author is blogger Low-Sodium Girl, Jess Goldman Foung, a thirty-something San Franciscan who lives a low-sodium life due to kidney failure. She lives a beautiful life in a Noe Valley home, with husband and daughter, cooking beautiful food inspired by SF's farmers' markets and best restaurants, proving via this lifestyle cookbook that a special diet can be an inspiration.12 chapters cover everything from setting up a low-sodium kitchen to eating at an airport, with 50 recipes including sodium content, serving size, and other nutritional information. 

There's no beautiful low-sodium book on the market, nor is there one that feels both comprehensive and contemporary. Low-So Good, with colour photography, lifestyle advice, and delicious recipes, is the book for a new low-sodium lifestyle for a wide audience
